page.title: 01District of Sourin, Rousay
page.content: The major part of the block is uncultivated moorland. Within this area there is a rich supply of peat which each household has a traditional right to use. Coastwards, a belt of cultivated land is populated by farming families. Beef and sheep farming are undertaken with mostly grass and barley being grown for feed. Vast numbers of rabbits are a pest to farmers. There is a market garden. Its produce is sold locally and on Mainland Orkney. A salmon hatchery is currently under construction. An electricity sub-station was built in 1983. 20 children attend the island's primary school. There are 2 full-time teachers. Children proceed to second- ary school in Kirkwall on Mainland Orkney where they are weekly boarders. The school building was extended in 1984 to include the Community Centre.
